abstract.p: Lee Francis letter disputes Richard Perle's July 13 Op-Ed article arguing case for national missile defense system

block.p: Re ''Senate Rejects Move for Tougher Testing of Antimissile System'' (news article, July 13):

Re ''Senate Rejects Move for Tougher Testing of Antimissile System'' (news article, July 13):
The failure of the recent nuclear missile defense test re-emphasizes two simple messages: it won't work, and its cost is obscene.
For the $60 billion projected to be spent, we could provide health care to millions of uninsured Americans.
What kind of country neglects urgent social concerns in exchange for theoretical military programs?

One thing has become clear in the half-century since Hiroshima and Nagasaki, and as doctors, we know this better than the missile-shield proponents. There is no certain protection against nuclear attack, and there would be no meaningful medical response.

Now is the time for citizens to say, Enough of a missile shield. Let's build a legacy for our children and grandchildren, which includes a world free from nuclear weapons and the threat of nuclear war.
The writer is president-elect of Physicians for Social Responsibility.
